definitions.definition: To perceive the truth or factuality of; to be certain of or that.
definitions.example: He knew something terrible was going to happen.

definitions.definition: To be aware of; to be cognizant of.
definitions.example: Did you know Michelle and Jack were getting divorced? ― Yes, I knew.

definitions.definition: To be acquainted or familiar with; to have encountered.
definitions.example: I know your mother, but I’ve never met your father.
Their relationship knew ups and downs.

definitions.definition: To be able to distinguish, to discern, particularly by contrast or comparison; to recognize the nature of.
definitions.example: I wouldn't know one from the other.

definitions.definition: To recognize as the same (as someone or something previously encountered) after an absence or change.
To understand or have a grasp of through experience or study.
definitions.example: His mother tongue is Italian, but he also knows French and English.

definitions.definition: To have sexual relations with. This meaning normally specified in modern English as e.g. to ’know someone in the biblical sense’ or to ‘know Biblically.’
To have knowledge; to have information, be informed.
To be or become aware or cognizant.
definitions.example: Did you know Michelle and Jack were getting divorced? ― Yes, I knew.

definitions.definition: To be able to play or perform (a song or other piece of music).
Any fact or situation which is known or familiar.
A constant or variable the value of which is already determined.
Identified as a specific type; famous, renowned.
